r_ele.r: どんぐりのせいくらべ

sense.gloss: having very little difference between one another, being much of a muchness, being more or less the same, height comparison among acorns
pointless competition (between two equally unimpressive parties), pissing contest
chipmunk (esp. the Siberian chipmunk, Tamias sibiricus)
trembling with fear, filled with trepidation

r_ele.r: かちゅうのくりをひろう

sense.gloss: to take a risk for someone, to endanger oneself for someone, to gather chestnuts from the fire
mashed sweet potatoes with sweetened chestnuts

r_ele.r: ももくりさんねんかきはちねん

sense.gloss: it often takes time for one's actions to bear fruit, planted peach and chestnut seeds take three years (to bear fruit), persimmons take eight
Tamias sibiricus lineatus (subspecies of Siberian chipmunk native to Hokkaido)
ground squirrel (esp. the Daurian ground squirrel, Spermophilus dauricus)
ground squirrel (esp. a ground squirrel of North America or Africa)
squirrel monkey (esp. the common squirrel monkey, Saimiri sciureus)
sweet made with soft beans (e.g. adzuki) and chestnuts
Taiwanese squirrel (subspecies of Pallas's squirrel, Callosciurus erythraeus thaiwanensis)
Hokkaido squirrel (subspecies of red squirrel, Sciurus vulgaris orientis)
chestnut rice, rice boiled with chestnuts
Auckland teal (Anas aucklandica), Auckland Islands teal

sdata.j: ↑栗↑↓ぐり↓は↑少↑↓すく↓なくとも１５↑分↑↓ふん↓は↑茹↑↓ゆ↓でなくてはいけない。
sdata.e: Chestnuts have to be boiled for at least fifteen minutes.

sdata.j: ↑栗鼠↑↓りす↓が↑池↑↓いけ↓で↑水浴↑↓みずあ↓びをしています。
sdata.e: A squirrel is taking a bath in the pond.

sdata.j: ↑白↑↓しろ↓い↑栗鼠↑↓りす↓と↑黒↑↓くろ↓い↑栗鼠↑↓りす↓の↑二↑↓に↓↑匹↑↓ひき↓の↑栗鼠↑↓りす↓がおおきな↑森↑↓もり↓の↑中↑↓なか↓に↑住↑↓す↓んでいました。
sdata.e: Two little squirrels, a white squirrel and a black squirrel, lived in a large forest.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑通↑↓とお↓りから↑栗↑↓ぐり↓を↑取↑↓と↓り↑除↑↓のぞ↓いた。
sdata.e: He cleared the street of chestnuts.

sdata.j: ↑栗鼠↑↓りす↓が↑激↑↓はげ↓しい↑風↑↓かぜ↓に↑逆↑↓さか↓らって↑進↑↓すす↓んでいた。
sdata.e: The squirrel advanced against the strong wind.

sdata.j: ↑栗↑↓くり↓の↑皮↑↓かわ↓をむく↑作業↑↓さぎょう↓に↑一苦労↑↓ひとくろう↓した。
sdata.e: It's a hassle to take the husks off of chestnuts.

sdata.j: ↑栗↑↓くり↓の↑皮↑↓かわ↓をむく↑作業↑↓さぎょう↓に↑一苦労↑↓ひとくろう↓した。
マロン・グラアセは↑栗↑↓ぐり↓の↑砂糖↑↓さとう↓漬で、↑日本↑↓にっぽん↓の↑甘納豆↑↓あまなっとう↓に↑当↑↓あた↓るだらう。
sdata.e: A marron glacé is a sugar coated chestnut, similar to the Japanese sweet natto.

sdata.j: ↑棹立↑↓さおだ↓ちした↑栗毛↑↓くりげ↓の↑牝馬↑↓ひんば↓は↑嘶↑↓いなな↓き、↑騎手↑↓きしゅ↓を↑落↑↓お↓とそうとした。
sdata.e: The prancing chestnut mare whinnied as she tried to get rid of the rider.

sdata.j: アナの↑髪↑↓かみ↓は↑栗色↑↓くりいろ↓だがマグダレナは↑金髪↑↓きんぱつ↓です。
sdata.e: Anna has chestnut brown hair, but Magdalena has blonde hair.

sdata.j: アナの↑髪↑↓かみ↓は↑栗色↑↓くりいろ↓だがマグダレナは↑金髪↑↓きんぱつ↓です。
sdata.e: Anna's hair is brown, but Magdalena's is blonde.

sdata.j: ↑絵文字↑↓えもじ↓は、↑１９９９↑↓せんきゅうひゃくきゅうじゅうきゅう↓↑年↑↓ねん↓に↑日本↑↓にほん↓の↑芸術↑↓げいじゅつ↓↑家↑↓か↓である↑栗田↑↓くりた↓↑穣↑↓しげ↓↑崇↑↓たか↓さんによって↑紹介↑↓しょうかい↓されたのが↑始↑↓はじ↓まりです。
sdata.e: Emojis were first introduced in 1999 by Japanese artist Shigetaka Kurita.

sdata.j: ↑栗↑↓ぐり↓を↑剥↑↓む↓くのって、めんどくさっ。
sdata.e: It's a hassle to take the husks off of chestnuts.

sdata.j: お↑母↑↓かあ↓さん、↑栗↑↓くり↓ご↑飯↑↓はん↓↑食↑↓た↓べたいから、↑栗↑↓くり↓ご↑飯↑↓はん↓↑作↑↓つく↓って。
sdata.e: Mom, I want some chestnut rice. Can you make some?

sdata.j: この↑栗毛↑↓くりげ↓↑馬↑↓ば↓、↑速↑↓はや↓いなぁ。
↑焼↑↓や↓き↑栗↑↓ぐり↓が↑好↑↓す↓きです。
